intro: Seseli eryngioides, commonly known as the spiked seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense umbels, typical of the family. Seseli eryngioides is often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and recognizable member of the Apiaceae family.
